MetDNA2 0.5.22

    • Instruction of MetDNA2

annotateMetaboliteMRN

annotateMetaboliteMRN.Rd

Annotate peak table from one metabolite.

annotateMetaboliteMRN(
  metabolite_name = "M175T962",
  metabolite_id = "C00062",
  formula = "C6H14N4O2",
  adduct = "M+H",
  scoring_approach = c("dp", "bonanza", "hybrid", "gnps"),
  instrument = c("SciexTripleTOF", "AgilentQTOF", "BrukerQTOF", "ThermoOrbitrap",
    "ThermoExploris", "AgilentDTIMMS", "BrukerTIMS"),
  mz = 175.118,
  rt = 961.6225,
  peak_mz_all,
  peak_rt_all,
  peak_ccs_all,
  ms2,
  mz_tol = 25,
  rt_tol = 30,
  ccs_tol = 4,
  dp_tol = 0.5,
  matched_frag_tol = 1,
  step = 1,
  metabolite,
  metabolite_ccs,
  metabolic_network,
  adduct_table,
  ...
)

Arguments

formula

The formula of metabolite.
adduct

The adduct of metabolite.
mz

The mz of metabolite.
rt

The RT of metabolite.
ms2

The ms2 data of peak table.
step

The reaction step.
metabolite

The kegg compound database.
metabolite.name

The metabolite name.
metabolite.id

The metabolite ID.
polarity

The polarity.
peak.mz

The mz of all peaks.
peak.rt

The RT of all peaks.
cor

The correlation of metabolite between all peaks.
mz.tol

The mz tolerance.
rt.tol

The RT tolerance for metabolite annotation. (%)
cor.tol

The cor tolerance.
dp.tol

The tolerance of dot product.
metabolic.network

kegg.rpair2
adduct.table

Adduct table.

Value

The metabolite annotation information.

Author

Zhiwei Zhou zhouzw@sioc.ac.cn
